name: Worldwide Potpourri Online Trivia | Wide World of Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first 16-year old player to appear in a major professional tournament?
questions.explanation:
Maria Sharapova.

	Sharapova moved from Russia at the age of 11 to train in the United States and became a pro at the young age of 16.

questions.text: Who won the 2008 Rugby World Cup Final?
questions.explanation:
New Zealand 34-20 over Australia.

	New Zealand defeated hot favourites Australia 34-20 at Suncorp Stadium to win the Rugby League World Cup for the first time. The match started with a confrontational haka, Australia marching forward to meet the Kiwis rather than watch from the ten-metre line. New Zealand almost opened the scoring, Benji Marshall just knocking one in the goal area.Australia then struck with two quick tries to captain Darren Lockyer and David Williams, a mid-week replacement for the injured Brent Tate. Australia almost scored a third time, however, Darren Lockyer knocked on over the goal line in similar circumstances to Benji.At this point Australia looked like they could run away with the match. Jeremy Smith then opened the scoring for the Kiwis by busting over right under the goal posts. Four minutes later New Zealand were in again, via an Anthony Laffranchi strip which led to a Jerome Ropati try. With only five minutes before the break, Darren Lockyer scored to put Australia in front 16-12 at halftime.

questions.text: From a fishing town, which Scottish football team is known as, The Blue Toon?
questions.explanation:
Peterhead.

	Peterhead played in the Highland League until being admitted into the Scottish football league in 2000. The team's nickname came from the people who were born in Peterhead.  They were known as Blue Tooners, or sometimes called Bloomogganners, aparrently from the fishermens blue stockings that they wore.

questions.text: In the world of cycling, Sarah Ulmer broke a record for the individual pursuit at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.
questions.explanation:
False.

	She broke the record at the 2004 Athens Games.

questions.text: Australian cricket superstar Don Bradman set a record for the highest score of First Class Cricket. What was his score?
questions.explanation:
452*.

	Bradman with NSW scored his 452* in 415 minutes in 1930 against Queensland.

questions.text: In the NFL football world, who was nicknamed "Kansas Comet"?
questions.explanation:
Gale Sayers.

	Gale Sayers was one of the fastest players ever to play. He spent his career with the Chicago Bears.  He scored 22 touchdowns as a rookie in 1965.  Sadly, his career was shortened and ended with a knee injury in less than 10 years. He was elected to the Hall of Fame in 1977.

questions.text: In tennis, the scores graduate in order by going 0, 15, 30, and the next number of what?
questions.explanation:
40.

	The exact origin of this is not known, but they believe in medieval times, they used a clock and they would use a quarter for each point. When it got to 60, the game would be over.

questions.text: Which of the following was born on October 29, 1970, and played for AZ, Vitesse, PSV, Barcelona, and PSV?
questions.explanation:
Philip Cocu.

	Good in every position but played most of his 700 official games in the centre of midfield. Cocu, held his own easily in a star studded team at Barcelona for 6 years, and made an impressive 101 caps for the national side.

questions.text: Who scored the first-ever century in Test Match Cricket?
questions.explanation:
Charles Bannerman.

	Charles Bannerman scored 165 v England in the first test at the MCG in 1877.  He retired hurt after he had split the index finger on his right hand by a ball from Ulyett.

questions.text: Greg Oden was the 1st overall draft pick by the Portland Trailblazers to play in the 2007-08 season. From what university did he hail from?
questions.explanation:
Ohio State.

	Oden was drafted by the Blazers but was not able to play the entire season due to a microfracture surgery on his right knee.
